title: How to Safely Jack Up Your Car
steps: Park the car on a flat, solid surface.
Apply the handbrake and place wheel chocks on the opposite wheels.
Identify the correct jack points using the owner’s manual or visible notches on the car’s chassis.
Position the jack under the designated lifting point and lift the car.
Place a jack stand under a sturdy part of the frame (such as the subframe) and lower the car onto it.
Ensure the car is stable and secure before performing any work.
When finished, use the jack to lift the car off the stand, then lower it slowly back to the ground.
Remove all tools and chocks before driving off
safety_tips: Never work under a car supported only by a jack—always use safety stands.
Use wheel chocks and handbrake to prevent the car from moving.
Ensure all tools and body parts are clear before lowering the car.
